meanings.definition: A system of religious veneration and devotion directed towards a particular figure or object.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, ancient tribes had cults that worshipped the sun.
meanings.sent2: The cults in that region have unique rituals and ceremonies.
meanings.sent3: The cults in the story believed the moon was made of cheese!
meanings.sent4: Her love for gardening was like a cults, with each plant receiving special attention.
meanings.sent5: The cults of the forest worshipped the mighty oak tree.

meanings.definition: A relatively small group of people having religious beliefs or practices regarded by others as strange or sinister.
meanings.sent1: The small cults gathered in secrecy to perform their rituals.
meanings.sent2: Some consider UFO cults to be unconventional and mysterious.
meanings.sent3: The cults of cat lovers met every Friday to discuss their furry friends.
meanings.sent4: The cults of fashionistas followed the latest trends religiously.
meanings.sent5: In the movie, the cults of aliens had peculiar customs and traditions.

meanings.definition: A misplaced or excessive admiration for a particular person or thing.
meanings.sent1: Her cults for pop stars led her to collect every album and poster.
meanings.sent2: The cults of celebrity worship can sometimes become obsessive.
meanings.sent3: His cults for chocolate was so extreme, he had a chocolate-themed room!
meanings.sent4: The cults of technology had everyone glued to their screens.
meanings.sent5: The cults for superheroes made him believe he could fly like them.
